fields.name: area_source_code
fields.label: Area Source
fields.description: The source file that was used to determine the tax lot's total building floor area

fields.name: area_sq_ft
fields.label: Area Square Footage
fields.description: Square footage of the lot area

fields.name: assessed_land_value_2019
fields.label: 2019 assessed land value
fields.description: The final tentative assessed land value for Fiscal Year 2019

fields.name: assessed_total_value_2019
fields.label: 2019 assessed total value
fields.description: The final tentative assessed total value for Fiscal Year 2019

fields.name: assessor_district_code
fields.label: Assessor district code
fields.description: Assessor district code

fields.name: bbl
fields.label: BBL
fields.description: Tax Borough, Block, and Lot (BBL).

fields.name: borough
fields.label: Borough
fields.description: The borough a lot is legally located in, regardless of which borough services the lot

fields.name: block
fields.label: Block
fields.description: Number assigned by Department of Finance identifying the tax block the lot is on

fields.name: lot
fields.label: Lot
fields.description: Number assigned by Department of Finance identifying the tax lot

fields.name: beginning_fiscal_year_tax_class
fields.label: Old Tax Class
fields.description: The Tax Class at the beginning of the fiscal year

fields.name: building_count
fields.label: Buildings on lot
fields.description: The number of buildings on the tax lot

fields.name: built_far
fields.label: Built Floor-Air-Ratio
fields.description: The Built Floor Area Ratio (FAR) is the total building floor area on the tax lot divided by the area of the tax lot: 1. The Built Floor Area Ratio (FAR) is the total building floor area divided by the area of the tax lot. 2. This field contains one to six numeric digits with an imbedded decimal after the fourth digit. 3. This is an estimate by City Planning based on rough building area and lot 36  FAR is calculated using the TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA and the LOT AREA. 4. The TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA is either based on gross building area also known as total gross square feet for all of the structures on the tax lot, including basements, attics and extensions such as attached garages, detached garages, pool houses and greenhouse OR the floor area was calculated from the DOF RPAD Master File using the building dimensions and number of stories for ONLY the largest structure on the tax lot depending on the source available. 5.The LOT AREA contains street beds when the lot contains “paper street” i.e., street mapped but not built.

fields.name: cbn_tax_class
fields.label: CBN Tax Class
fields.description: During the final period, contains the tax class from the CBN period.

fields.name: census_block_2010
fields.label: Census Block (2010)
fields.description: 2010 census blocks are the smallest geographic areas reported on by the U.S. Census Bureau for the 2010 census. Each census block is unique within a census tract

fields.name: census_tract_2010
fields.label: Census Tract (2010)
fields.description: 2010 census tracts are geographic areas defined by the U.S. Census Bureau for the 2010 Census. Each census tract is unique within a borough (see BOROUGH)

fields.name: commercial_overlay_1
fields.label: Commercial overlay 1
fields.description: The commercial zoning district assigned to the tax lot by the Department of City Planning: C1-1 C1-2 C1-3 C1-4  C1-5  C2-1  C2-2  C2-3  C2-4  C2-5

fields.name: commercial_overlay_2
fields.label: Commercial overlay 2
fields.description: The commercial zoning district assigned to the tax lot by the Department of City Planning: C1-1 C1-2 C1-3 C1-4  C1-5  C2-1  C2-2  C2-3  C2-4  C2-5

fields.name: commercial_sq_ft
fields.label: Commercial Area
fields.description: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the structure(s) allocated for commercial use: 1. Originally Square Footage came from sketches but for both New Construction & Alterations it comes from site visits. 2. An update to the Floor Area is triggered by the issuance of a Department of Buildings Permit, feedback from the public and scheduled visits by the Department of Finance assessors. 3. A COMMERCIAL FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. 4. The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA. 5. COMMERCIAL FLOOR AREA does not contain a condominium’s Common Area.

fields.name: community_district
fields.label: Community District
fields.description: The community district (CD) or joint interest area (JIA) that the tax lot is located in, or partially located in

fields.name: corner_lot
fields.label: Corner Lot
fields.description: The code to indicate a corner lot on two streets.  VALUES - 'NE', 'NW', 'SE', 'SW', AND 'CR'.

fields.name: council_district
fields.label: City Council District
fields.description: The city council district that the tax lot is located in

fields.name: current_tax_class_code
fields.label: Tax Class
fields.description: Current Property Tax Class Code (New York State classification):  TAX CLASS 1 = 1-3 UNIT RESIDENCES  TAX CLASS 1A = 1-3 STORY CONDOMINIUMS  ORIGINALLY A CONDO  TAX CLASS 1B = RESIDENTIAL VACANT LAND  TAX CLASS 1C = 1-3 UNIT CONDOMINUMS  ORIGINALLY TAX CLASS 1  TAX CLASS 1D = SELECT BUNGALOW COLONIES  TAX CLASS 2 = APARTMENTS  TAX CLASS 2A = APARTMENTS WITH 4-6 UNITS  TAX CLASS 2B = APARTMENTS WITH 7-10 UNITS  TAX CLASS 2C = COOPS/CONDOS WITH 2-10 UNITS  TAX CLASS 3 = UTILITIES (EXCEPT CEILING RR)  TAX CLASS 4A = UTILITIES - CEILING RAILROADS  TAX CLASS 4 = ALL OTHERS  '1' A0 - A9, B1 - B9, C0, G0, R3, R6, R7, S0 - S2, V0, V2, V3, Z0  '2' C1 - C9, D0 - D9, R0, R1, R2, R4, R8, R9, S3, S4, S5, S9 '3' U1 - U2, U4 - U9 '4' ALL OTHERS

fields.name: depth_ft
fields.label: Lot Depth
fields.description: Lot depth in feet

fields.name: e_desig_number
fields.label: E-Designation Number
fields.description: Assigned to lots that are deemed to have noise, air quality problems, or hazardous materials

fields.name: easement_count
fields.label: Number of Easements
fields.description: The number of easements on the tax lot

fields.name: easement_type
fields.label: Easement Type
fields.description: The type of use permitted by the easement on the property: null Indicates the lot has no Easement. 'A' Indicates the portion of the Lot that has an Air Easement. 'B' Indicates Non-Air Rights. 'E' Indicates the portion of the lot that has a Land Easement. 'F' THRU 'M' Are duplicates of 'E'. 'N' Indicates Non-Transit Easement. 'P' Indicates Piers. 'R' Indicates Railroads. 'S' Indicates Street. 'U' Indicates U.S. Government.

fields.name: exempt_class_code
fields.label: Exemption Tax Class
fields.description: Exemption Class - used for fully exempt properties only

fields.name: exempt_property_restored_on
fields.label: Exempt property restored date
fields.description: Exempt property restored date

fields.name: extension_type
fields.label: Extension Type
fields.description: Type of extension on the lot: 'E' = EXTENSION 'G' = GARAGE 'EG' = EXTENSION AND GARAGE

fields.name: factory_sq_ft
fields.label: Factory Area
fields.description: The estimated square footage of exterior dimensions of the portion of the structure(s) allocated for factory, warehouse or loft use: 1. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures. 2. An update to the Floor Area is triggered by the issuance of a Department of Buildings Permit, feedback from the public and scheduled visits by the Department of Finance assessors. 3. An OTHER FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. 4. The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA.

fields.name: file_year
fields.label: Year of File
fields.description: Four digit year of the file

fields.name: final_actual_assessed_land_value
fields.label: Final Actual Assessed Land Value
fields.description: Final Actual Assessed Land Value

fields.name: final_actual_assessed_total_value
fields.label: Final Actual Assessed Total Value
fields.description: Final Actual Assessed Total Value

fields.name: final_actual_exempt_land_value
fields.label: Final Actual Exempt Land Value
fields.description: Final Actual Exempt Land Value

fields.name: final_actual_exempt_total_value
fields.label: Final Actual Exempt Total Value
fields.description: Final Actual Exempt Total Value

fields.name: final_transitional_assessed_land_value
fields.label: Final Transitional Assessed Land Value
fields.description: Final Transitional Assessed Land Value

fields.name: final_transitional_assessed_total_value
fields.label: Final Transitional Assessed Total Value
fields.description: Final Transitional Assessed Total Value

fields.name: final_transitional_exempt_land_value
fields.label: Final Transitional Exempt Land Value
fields.description: Final Transitional Exempt Land Value

fields.name: final_transitional_exempt_total_value
fields.label: Final Transitional Exempt Total Value
fields.description: Final Transitional Exempt Total Value

fields.name: fire_company
fields.label: Fire Company
fields.description: Fire Company: E - Engine L - Ladder Q - Squad

fields.name: floor_count
fields.label: Floors of tallest building
fields.description: In the tallest building on the tax lot, the number of full and partial stories starting from the ground floor

fields.name: garage_sq_ft
fields.label: Garage Area
fields.description: The estimated square footage of exterior dimensions of the portion of the structure(s) allocated for garage use: 1. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures. 2. An update to the Floor Area is triggered by the issuance of a Department of Buildings Permit, feedback from the public and scheduled visits by the Department of Finance assessors. 3. A GARAGE FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. 4. The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA.

fields.name: historic_district
fields.label: Historic District
fields.description: Historic District

fields.name: is_irregularly_shaped
fields.label: Irregularly Shaped
fields.description: Irregularly shaped lot

fields.name: is_legislation_capped
fields.label: Assessed Value Legislation Cap
fields.description: Is the Assessed Value Limit capped due to state legislation? (Yes/No)

fields.name: is_old_av_legislation_capped
fields.label: Old AV Legislation Capped
fields.description: ‘1’ = AV of property is capped due to state legislation.

fields.name: land_use
fields.label: New York City Zoning
fields.description: 01 One &Two Family Buildings 02 Multi-Family Walk-Up Buildings 03 Multi-Family Elevator Buildings 04 Mixed Residential & Commercial Buildings 05 Commercial & Office Buildings 06 Industrial & Manufacturing 07 Transportation & Utility 08 Public Facilities & Institutions 09 Open Space & Outdoor Recreation 10 Parking Facilities 11 Vacant Land

fields.name: landmark_name
fields.label: Landmark Name
fields.description: Landmark Name:  The name of an individual landmark, landmark site (e.g. Richmondtown Restoration), or an interior landmark, as designated by the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission.

fields.name: last_descriptive_changed_on
fields.label: Last Descriptive Change
fields.description: Date of last descriptive change

fields.name: limited_height_district
fields.label: Limited Height District
fields.description: The limited height district assigned to the tax lot by Department of City Planning: 1. If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, ZONING, LIMITED HEIGHT DISTRICT could be associated with any of the ZONING, ZONING DISTRICT fields. 2. Limited height districts are coded using the three to five character district symbols that are listed in Appendix B: Special Purpose and Limited Height Districts.

fields.name: maximum_commercial_far
fields.label: Maximum Commercial FAR
fields.description: The Maximum Allowable Commercial Floor Area Ratio (FAR): The Maximum Allowable Commercial Floor Area Ratio (FAR)  1. This field contains from one to four numeric digits with an imbedded decimal after the second digit. 2. The Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratios are exclusive of bonuses for plazas, plaza-connected open areas, arcades or other amenities. 3. For properties in Mixed Use Special Districts, uses the wide street Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratio. Since the Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratio in Mixed Use Special Districts is actually determined by whether the property is located on a wide street or a narrow street.

fields.name: maximum_facility_far
fields.label: Maximum Facility FAR
fields.description: The Maximum Allowable Facility Floor Area Ratio (FAR): 1. This field contains from one to four numeric digits with an imbedded decimal after the second digit. 2. The Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratios are exclusive of bonuses for plazas, plaza-connected open areas, arcades or other amenities. 3. For properties in Mixed Use Special Districts, uses the wide street Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratio. Since the Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratio in Mixed Use Special Districts is actually determined by whether the property is located on a wide street or a narrow street.

fields.name: maximum_residential_far
fields.label: Maximum Residential FAR
fields.description: Maximum allowed ratio of building residential floor area to size of land it is built on: The Maximum Allowable Residential Floor Area Ratio (FAR) 1. This field contains from one to four numeric digits with an imbedded decimal after the second digit. 2. The Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratios are exclusive of bonuses for plazas, plaza-connected open areas, arcades or other amenities. 3. For properties zoned R6, R7, R7-1, R8 or R9 the Maximum Allowable Floor Area reflects the maximum achievable floor area under ideal conditions. 4. For properties in Mixed Use Special Districts, PLUTO uses the wide street Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratio. Since the Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratio in Mixed Use Special Districts is actually determined by whether the property is located on a wide street or a narrow street

fields.name: money_final_changed_on
fields.label: Date of the latest Final money change
fields.description: Date of the last money change occurring during the Final Value. If the date contains 00/00/0000 then the final assessed values are the same as the tentative values

fields.name: money_tentative_changed_on
fields.label: Date of the latest Tentative Period money change
fields.description: Date of the last money change occurring during the Tentative Period or the date of the last money change made during the Change By Notice Period. If the date contains 00/00/0000 then the tentative assessed values are the same as the current assessed values

fields.name: new_market_land_value
fields.label: New Market Value of Land
fields.description: If not zero, New market value of the land

fields.name: new_market_value_of_property
fields.label: New Total Market Value of Property
fields.description: If not zero, new Total Market Value of property

fields.name: office_sq_ft
fields.label: Office Area
fields.description: An estimate of the square footage of exterior dimensions of the portion of the structure(s) allocated for office use: 1. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures. 2. An update to the Floor Area is triggered by the issuance of a Department of Buildings Permit, feedback from the public and scheduled visits by the Department of Finance assessors. 3. An OFFICE FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. 4. The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA.

fields.name: old_protest_applicant
fields.label: Old Protest Applicant
fields.description: Type of applicant applying for a tax commission reduction (Old)

fields.name: old_protest_code
fields.label: Old Protest Code
fields.description: Previous challenge to the Department of Finance’s assessments and corrections of erroneous information associated with the lot: 1st character 1 = form TC101 (generally for class 2 and 4) 5 = form TC105 (reuc) 6 = form TC106 (reclasss) 8 = form TC108 (class 1) 9 = form TC109 (condos) 2nd character numeric indicating duplicates 3rd character not used at this time.

fields.name: online_changed_on
fields.label: Date of the latest on-line change
fields.description: Date of the latest on-line change to the AV-FULLVAL or AV-FULLVAL-LAND

fields.name: other_sq_ft
fields.label: Other Area
fields.description: An estimate of the square footage of exterior dimensions of the portion of the structure(s) allocated for other than Residential, Office, Retail, Garage, Storage, Loft or Factory use

fields.name: owner_code
fields.label: Lot Owner Type
fields.description: The type of entity that owns the tax lot: C City Ownership M Mixed City & Private Ownership O Other – Public Authority, State or Federal Ownership P Private Ownership – Either the tax lot has started an “in rem” action or it was once city owned. X Mixed (Excludes property with a C, M, O, or P ownership code). Fully tax exempt property that could be owned by the city, state, or federal government; a public authority; or a private institution blank Unknown (Usually Private Ownership)

fields.name: owner_name
fields.label: Lot Owner Name
fields.description: Name of person or entity that owns the tax lot

fields.name: police_precinct
fields.label: Police Precinct
fields.description: The police precinct in which the tax lot is located

fields.name: property_exemptions_count
fields.label: Number of Exemptions
fields.description: Counter containing the number of exemptions on the property

fields.name: protest_code_1
fields.label: Protest Code
fields.description: Challenges to the Department of Finance’s assessments and corrections of erroneous information associated with the lot: 1st character 1 = form TC101 (generally for class 2 and 4) 5 = form TC105 (reuc) 6 = form TC106 (reclasss) 8 = form TC108 (class 1)  9 = form TC109 (condos) 2nd character numeric indicating duplicates 3rd character not used at this time.

fields.name: protest_code_2
fields.label: Protest Code 2
fields.description: Challenges to the Department of Finance’s assessments and corrections of erroneous information associated with the lot: 1st character 1 = form TC101 (generally for class 2 and 4) 5 = form TC105 (reuc) 6 = form TC106 (reclasss) 8 = form TC108 (class 1)  9 = form TC109 (condos) 2nd character numeric indicating duplicates 3rd character not used at this time.

fields.name: residential_sq_ft
fields.label: Residential Area
fields.description: An estimate of the square footage of exterior dimensions of the portion of the structure(s) allocated for residential use: 1. An update to the Floor Area is triggered by the issuance of a Department of Buildings Permit, feedback from the public and scheduled visits by the Department of Finance assessors. 2. RESIDENTIAL FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. 3. The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA 4. RESIDENTIAL FLOOR AREA does not contain a condominium’s Common Area

fields.name: residential_unit_count
fields.label: Total Residential Units
fields.description: The total number of residential units in all buildings on the tax lot

fields.name: retail_sq_ft
fields.label: Retail Area
fields.description: An estimate of the square footage of exterior dimensions of the portion of the structure(s) allocated for retail use: 1. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures. 2. An update to the Floor Area is triggered by the issuance of a Department of Buildings Permit, feedback from the public and scheduled visits by the Department of Finance assessors. 3. A RETAIL FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. 4. The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA.

fields.name: section_volume_number
fields.label: Section Volume Number
fields.description: A Geographic subset of Boro comprised of a specific block ranges

fields.name: special_purpose_district_1
fields.label: Special Purpose District 1
fields.description: The special purpose zoning district assigned to the tax lot by Department of City Planning:  With the exception of four areas in the city with coterminous Special Districts, if more than one special purpose district exists on the tax lot, ZONING, SPECIAL PURPOSE DISTRICT 1 represents the special purpose district occupying the greatest percentage of the lot area.  1. In the area of Manhattan covered by both the Special Midtown District and the Special Clinton District, Special Purpose District 1 is CL and Special Purpose District 2 is MID. 2. In the area of Manhattan covered by both the Special Midtown District and the Special Transit District, Special Purpose District 1 is MID and Special Purpose 2 is TA. 3. In the area of Manhattan covered by both the Special 125th Street District and the Special Transit District, Special Purpose District 1 is 125 and Special District 2 is TA. 4. In the area of Brooklyn covered by both the Special Enhanced Commercial District -4 and Mixed Use District-16 (Ocean Hill/East New York), Special Purpose District 1 is EC-6 and Special Purpose District 2 is MX-16.

fields.name: special_purpose_district_2
fields.label: Special Purpose District 2
fields.description: The special purpose zoning district assigned to the tax lot by Department of City Planning:  With the exception of four areas in the city with coterminous Special Districts, if more than one special purpose district exists on the tax lot, ZONING, SPECIAL PURPOSE DISTRICT 1 represents the special purpose district occupying the greatest percentage of the lot area.  1. In the area of Manhattan covered by both the Special Midtown District and the Special Clinton District, Special Purpose District 1 is CL and Special Purpose District 2 is MID. 2. In the area of Manhattan covered by both the Special Midtown District and the Special Transit District, Special Purpose District 1 is MID and Special Purpose 2 is TA. 3. In the area of Manhattan covered by both the Special 125th Street District and the Special Transit District, Special Purpose District 1 is 125 and Special District 2 is TA. 4. In the area of Brooklyn covered by both the Special Enhanced Commercial District -4 and Mixed Use District-16 (Ocean Hill/East New York), Special Purpose District 1 is EC-6 and Special Purpose District 2 is MX-16.

fields.name: special_purpose_district_3
fields.label: Special Purpose District 3
fields.description: The special purpose zoning district assigned to the tax lot by Department of City Planning:  With the exception of four areas in the city with coterminous Special Districts, if more than one special purpose district exists on the tax lot, ZONING, SPECIAL PURPOSE DISTRICT 1 represents the special purpose district occupying the greatest percentage of the lot area.  1. In the area of Manhattan covered by both the Special Midtown District and the Special Clinton District, Special Purpose District 1 is CL and Special Purpose District 2 is MID. 2. In the area of Manhattan covered by both the Special Midtown District and the Special Transit District, Special Purpose District 1 is MID and Special Purpose 2 is TA. 3. In the area of Manhattan covered by both the Special 125th Street District and the Special Transit District, Special Purpose District 1 is 125 and Special District 2 is TA. 4. In the area of Brooklyn covered by both the Special Enhanced Commercial District -4 and Mixed Use District-16 (Ocean Hill/East New York), Special Purpose District 1 is EC-6 and Special Purpose District 2 is MX-16.

fields.name: storage_sq_ft
fields.label: Storage Area
fields.description: An estimate of the square footage of exterior dimensions of the portion of the structure(s) allocated for storage or loft purposes: 1. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures. 2. An update to the Floor Area is triggered by the issuance of a Department of Buildings Permit, feedback from the public and scheduled visits by the Department of Finance assessors. 3. A STORAGE FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. 4. The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA.

fields.name: tax_reduction_applicant_type_1
fields.label: Protest Applicant Type
fields.description: The type of applicant applying for a tax commission reduction

fields.name: tax_reduction_applicant_type_2
fields.label: Protest Applicant Type 2
fields.description: The type of applicant applying for a tax commission reduction

fields.name: location_type
fields.label: Lot Location Type
fields.description: 0 Mixed or Unknown. 1 Block Assemblage. A tax lot which encompasses an entire block. 2 Waterfront. A tax lot bordering on a body of water. Waterfront lots may contain a small amount of submerged land. 3 Corner. A tax lot bordering on two intersecting streets. 4 Through. A tax lot which connects two streets and fronts on both streets. A lot with two frontages is not necessarily a through lot. For example, an L-shaped lot with two frontages would be coded as an Inside Lot (5). 5 Inside. A tax lot which is not an assemblage, waterfront, corner, through, interior, island, alley or submerged lot. 6 Interior Lot. A tax lot that has no street frontage. 7 Island Lot. A tax lot that is entirely surrounded by water. 8 Alley Lot. A tax lot that is too narrow to accommodate a building. The lot is usually 12 feet or less in width. 9 Submerged Land Lot. A tax lot that is totally or almost completely submerged.

fields.name: width
fields.label: Width
fields.description: Lot frontage in feet

fields.name: zoning_district_1
fields.label: Zoning District 1
fields.description: 1. The zoning district classification of the tax lot or in a limited number of cases the Zoning Resolution section number that pertains to special requirements for selected properties in Queens. 2. If the tax lot is divided by a zoning boundary line, ZONING, ZONING DISTRICT 1 represents the zoning district classification occupying the greatest percentage of the tax lot’s area. 3. For example: Tax Lot 98 is divided by a zoning boundary line into Part A and Part B. Part A, the largest portion of the lot, is in a commercial zoning district, while Part B is in a residential zoning district. ZONING, ZONING DISTRICT 1 will contain the commercial zoning district associated with Part A.  R1-1 - R10H Residential Districts C1-6 - C8-4 Commercial Districts M1-1 – M3-2 Manufacturing Districts M1-1/R5 – M1-6/R10 Mixed Manufacturing & Residential Districts BPC Battery Park City PARK New York City Parks PARKNYS New York State Parks PARKUS United States Parks ZNA Zoning Not Applicable ZR 11-151 See Section 11-151 of the Zoning Resolution for special requirements for selected properties in Queens

ZONING, ZONING DISTRICT 1 will contain the commercial zoning district associated with Part A. fields.name: centroid_geom
fields.label: Centroid Geometry
fields.description: Centroid latitude and longitude of the lot

fields.name: boundaries_geom
fields.label: Boundaries Geoetry
fields.description: Boundary geometry of the lot
